week3.practice2_html:
What it is

The Popeye Protocol gently raises your iron stores through food choices and daily habits, so your hair has the oxygen and nutrients it needs to strengthen and grow.

Why this practice matters for you now

Jasmine, youâ€™re in the regrowthâ€‘start phase â€” the shedding has steadied, and those baby hairs are proof your follicles are reawakening. Because youâ€™ve had low iron before and heavy periods can quietly deplete your levels again, replenishing iron now is your â€œbig domino.â€ It builds the steady energy and blood flow your scalp needs to move from fragile fuzz to thriving strands in the months ahead.

  2. Pair wisely at lunch and dinner: Combine plant or animal iron sources (lentils, spinach, beef, or tofu) with something fresh and acidic â€” lemon juice, peppers, or tomatoes â€” to double absorption.
  3. Avoid common blockers: Skip tea or coffee with meals and leave at least 60â€¯minutes before or after â€” they can cut iron uptake by nearly half.

week3.practice3_html:
What it is

Why this practice matters for you now

Jasmine, youâ€™re entering the regrowthâ€‘start phase â€” your follicles are waking back up after a long stressâ€‘driven plateau. Think of this as feeding the new growth thatâ€™s already begun.

Step-by-step implementation

  1. Pick one omegaâ€‘3 source to add daily â€” salmon, sardines, trout, chia, flax, or algae oil if you avoid fish.
  2. Have a palmâ€‘sized portion (or 1â€¯tbsp seeds) with your main meal to boost absorption and keep blood sugar calm.
  3. If you use a supplement, choose one labeled for freshness (no â€œfishy burpâ€ smell) and check expiry dates to avoid rancid oils.
